forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 58. North northwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 72, with temperatures falling to around 66 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 5 to 17 mph.

weather_report:
As the early hours of the morning settle gently into downtown San Francisco, a soft clarity envelops the city. The forecast signals a transition from the night’s clouds, now yielding to numerous clear patches, allowing the stars their moment to twinkle above. The low temperature of 58 degrees lingers in the air, inviting a cozy layering of clothing—a light sweater or long-sleeve shirt would suffice for those making early ventures out. 

As dawn breaks, Tuesday promises a sunlit embrace with highs inching towards a pleasant 72. It’s a day that unfolds whimsically, shifting from an invigorating coolness to the warmth of midday, thus carrying the promise of vibrant vistas painted by the golden hues of sunlight. Expect a laid-back breeze, tapping around 5 to 17 miles per hour, as it playfully tousles hair and rustles leaves. Although the sprawling ocean may still hint at a lurking marine layer, the warm sun beckons outdoor escapades. Consider a stroll through one of the neighborhood parks or perhaps an early coffee at a lovely café, where you can revel in the gentle hum of city life as it stirs awake. Dress kindly for the fluctuating warmth—layers will be your ally as you navigate the interplay of sun and lingering cool breezes, embracing a day that offers a simple yet profound charm, unspoiled by the clutches of fog.
